## Description {#details}

This file lowers exception-related instructions and setjmp/longjmp function calls to use Emscripten&#39;s library functions.

The pass uses JavaScript&#39;s try and catch mechanism in case of Emscripten EH/SjLj and Wasm EH intrinsics in case of Emscripten SjLJ.


<ul>
<li>Emscripten exception handling This pass lowers invokes and landingpads into library functions in JS glue code. Invokes are lowered into function wrappers called invoke wrappers that exist in JS side, which wraps the original function call with JS try-catch. If an exception occurred, cxa&#95;throw() function in JS side sets some variables (see below) so we can check whether an exception occurred from wasm code and handle it appropriately.</li>
<li>Emscripten setjmp-longjmp handling This pass lowers setjmp to a reasonably-performant approach for emscripten. The idea is that each block with a setjmp is broken up into two parts: the part containing setjmp and the part right after the setjmp. The latter part is either reached from the setjmp, or later from a longjmp. To handle the longjmp, all calls that might longjmp are also called using invoke wrappers and thus JS / try-catch. JS longjmp() function also sets some variables so we can check / whether a longjmp occurred from wasm code. Each block with a function call that might longjmp is also split up after the longjmp call. After the longjmp call, we check whether a longjmp occurred, and if it did, which setjmp it corresponds to, and jump to the right post-setjmp block. We assume setjmp-longjmp handling always run after EH handling, which means we don&#39;t expect any exception-related instructions when SjLj runs. FIXME Currently this scheme does not support indirect call of setjmp, because of the limitation of the scheme itself. fastcomp does not support it either.</li>
</ul>


In detail, this pass does following things:

1) Assumes the existence of global variables: <b>THREW</b>, <b>threwValue &#95;&#95;THREW</b> and <b>threwValue are defined in compiler-rt in Emscripten. These variables are used for both exceptions and setjmp/longjmps. &#95;&#95;THREW</b> indicates whether an exception or a longjmp occurred or not. 0 means nothing occurred, 1 means an exception occurred, and other numbers mean a longjmp occurred. In the case of longjmp, <b>THREW</b> variable indicates the corresponding setjmp buffer the longjmp corresponds to. &#95;&#95;threwValue is 0 for exceptions, and the argument to longjmp in case of longjmp.


<ul>
<li>Emscripten exception handling</li>
</ul>


2) We assume the existence of setThrew and setTempRet0/getTempRet0 functions at link time. setThrew exists in Emscripten&#39;s compiler-rt:

void setThrew(uintptr&#95;t threw, int value) &#123; if (<b>THREW</b> == 0) &#123; <b>THREW</b> = threw; &#95;&#95;threwValue = value; &#125; &#125;

<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and catch mechanism in case of Emscripten EH/SjLj and Wasm EH intrinsics in</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Emscripten exception handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This pass lowers invokes and landingpads into library functions in JS glue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="comment">/// code. Invokes are lowered into function wrappers called invoke wrappers that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exist in JS side, which wraps the original function call with JS try-catch.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If an exception occurred, cxa&#95;throw() function in JS side sets some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="comment">/// variables (see below) so we can check whether an exception occurred from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="comment">/// wasm code and handle it appropriately.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Emscripten setjmp-longjmp handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This pass lowers setjmp to a reasonably-performant approach for emscripten.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The idea is that each block with a setjmp is broken up into two parts: the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// part containing setjmp and the part right after the setjmp. The latter part</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is either reached from the setjmp, or later from a longjmp. To handle the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// longjmp, all calls that might longjmp are also called using invoke wrappers</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and thus JS / try-catch. JS longjmp() function also sets some variables so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// we can check / whether a longjmp occurred from wasm code. Each block with a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function call that might longjmp is also split up after the longjmp call.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// After the longjmp call, we check whether a longjmp occurred, and if it did,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which setjmp it corresponds to, and jump to the right post-setjmp block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We assume setjmp-longjmp handling always run after EH handling, which means</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// we don&#39;t expect any exception-related instructions when SjLj runs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// FIXME Currently this scheme does not support indirect call of setjmp,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// because of the limitation of the scheme itself. fastcomp does not support it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// either.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In detail, this pass does following things:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1) Assumes the existence of global variables: &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;threwValue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; and &#95;&#95;threwValue are defined in compiler-rt in Emscripten.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">///    These variables are used for both exceptions and setjmp/longjmps.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; indicates whether an exception or a longjmp occurred or not. 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">///    means nothing occurred, 1 means an exception occurred, and other numbers</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">///    mean a longjmp occurred. In the case of longjmp, &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; variable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">///    indicates the corresponding setjmp buffer the longjmp corresponds to.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;threwValue is 0 for exceptions, and the argument to longjmp in case of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">///    longjmp.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Emscripten exception handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2) We assume the existence of setThrew and setTempRet0/getTempRet0 functions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">///    at link time. setThrew exists in Emscripten&#39;s compiler-rt:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">///    void setThrew(uintptr&#95;t threw, int value) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///      if (&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; == 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">///        &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; = threw;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">///        &#95;&#95;threwValue = value;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">///    setTempRet0 is called from &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;find&#95;matching&#95;catch() in JS glue code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">///    In exception handling, getTempRet0 indicates the type of an exception</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">///    caught, and in setjmp/longjmp, it means the second argument to longjmp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">///    function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">///      invoke @func(arg1, arg2) to label %invoke.cont unwind label %lpad</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">///      call @&#95;&#95;invoke&#95;SIG(func, arg1, arg2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val = &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">///      if (%&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val == 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">///        goto %lpad</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">///      else</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">///         goto %invoke.cont</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///    SIG is a mangled string generated based on the LLVM IR-level function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">///    signature. After LLVM IR types are lowered to the target wasm types,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">///    the names for these wrappers will change based on wasm types as well,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///    as in invoke&#95;vi (function takes an int and returns void). The bodies of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///    these wrappers will be generated in JS glue code, and inside those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">///    wrappers we use JS try-catch to generate actual exception effects. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">///    also calls the original callee function. An example wrapper in JS code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">///    would look like this:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">///      function invoke&#95;vi(index,a1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">///        try &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">///          Module&#91;&quot;dynCall&#95;vi&quot;&#93;(index,a1); // This calls original callee</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">///        &#125; catch(e) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">///          if (typeof e !== &#39;number&#39; &amp;&amp; e !== &#39;longjmp&#39;) throw e;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">///          &#95;setThrew(1, 0); // setThrew is called here</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">///        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">///    If an exception is thrown, &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; will be set to true in a wrapper,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">///    so we can jump to the right BB based on this value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 4) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %val = landingpad catch c1 catch c2 catch c3 ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">///      ... use %val ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %fmc = call @&#95;&#95;cxa&#95;find&#95;matching&#95;catch&#95;N(c1, c2, c3, ...)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %val = &#123;%fmc, getTempRet0()&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">///      ... use %val ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Here N is a number calculated based on the number of clauses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///    setTempRet0 is called from &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;find&#95;matching&#95;catch() in JS glue code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 5) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">///      resume &#123;%a, %b&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">///      call @&#95;&#95;resumeException(%a)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">///    where &#95;&#95;resumeException() is a function in JS glue code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 6) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">///      call @llvm.eh.typeid.for(type) (intrinsic)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">///      call @llvm&#95;eh&#95;typeid&#95;for(type)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">///    llvm&#95;eh&#95;typeid&#95;for function will be generated in JS glue code.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Emscripten setjmp / longjmp handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If there are calls to longjmp()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">///      longjmp(env, val)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">///      emscripten&#95;longjmp(env, val)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If there are calls to setjmp()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2) In the function entry that calls setjmp, initialize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">///    functionInvocationId as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">///    functionInvocationId = alloca(4)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Note: the alloca size is not important as this pointer is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">///    merely used for pointer comparisions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">///      setjmp(env)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp(env, label, functionInvocationId)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp records the necessary info (the label and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">///    functionInvocationId) to the &quot;env&quot;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">///    A BB with setjmp is split into two after setjmp call in order to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">///    make the post-setjmp BB the possible destination of longjmp BB.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 4) Lower every call that might longjmp into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">///      call @&#95;&#95;invoke&#95;SIG(func, arg1, arg2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val = &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">///      %&#95;&#95;threwValue.val = &#95;&#95;threwValue;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">///      if (%&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val != 0 &amp; %&#95;&#95;threwValue.val != 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">///        %label = &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test(%&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val, functionInvocationId);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">///        if (%label == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">///          emscripten&#95;longjmp(%&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val, %&#95;&#95;threwValue.val);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">///        setTempRet0(%&#95;&#95;threwValue.val);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#125; else &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">///        %label = -1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">///      longjmp&#95;result = getTempRet0();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">///      switch %label &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">///        label 1: goto post-setjmp BB 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">///        label 2: goto post-setjmp BB 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">///        ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="comment">///        default: goto splitted next BB</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test examines the jmp buf to see if it was for a matching</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">///    setjmp call. After calling an invoke wrapper, if a longjmp occurred,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95; will be the address of matching jmp&#95;buf buffer and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;threwValue be the second argument to longjmp.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test returns a setjmp label, a unique ID to each setjmp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">///    callsite. Label 0 means this longjmp buffer does not correspond to one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="comment">///    of the setjmp callsites in this function, so in this case we just chain</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="comment">///    the longjmp to the caller. Label -1 means no longjmp occurred.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Otherwise we jump to the right post-setjmp BB based on the label.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Wasm setjmp / longjmp handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This mode still uses some Emscripten library functions but not JavaScript&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="comment">/// try-catch mechanism. It instead uses Wasm exception handling intrinsics,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which will be lowered to exception handling instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If there are calls to longjmp()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1) Lower</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="comment">///      longjmp(env, val)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">///    into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="comment">///      &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;longjmp(env, val)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If there are calls to setjmp()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2) and 3): The same as 2) and 3) in Emscripten SjLj.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (functionInvocationId initialization + setjmp callsite transformation)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 4) Create a catchpad with a wasm.catch() intrinsic, which returns the value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// thrown by &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;longjmp function. In the runtime library, we have an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// equivalent of the following struct:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">/// struct &#95;&#95;WasmLongjmpArgs &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">///   void &#42;env;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">///   int val;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The thrown value here is a pointer to the struct. We use this struct to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">/// transfer two values by throwing a single value. Wasm throw and catch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions are capable of throwing and catching multiple values, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it also requires multivalue support that is currently not very reliable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="comment">/// TODO Switch to throwing and catching two values without using the struct</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All longjmpable function calls will be converted to an invoke that will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">/// unwind to this catchpad in case a longjmp occurs. Within the catchpad, we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">/// test the thrown values using &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test function as we do for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Emscripten SjLj. The main difference is, in Emscripten SjLj, we need to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">/// transform every longjmpable callsite into a sequence of code including</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test() call; in Wasm SjLj we do the testing in only one</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">/// place, in this catchpad.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">/// After testing calling &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test(), if the longjmp does not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">/// correspond to one of the setjmps within the current function, it rethrows</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the longjmp by calling &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;longjmp(). If it corresponds to one of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">/// setjmps in the function, we jump to the beginning of the function, which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="comment">/// contains a switch to each post-setjmp BB. Again, in Emscripten SjLj, this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="comment">/// switch is added for every longjmpable callsite; in Wasm SjLj we do this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">/// only once at the top of the function. (after functionInvocationId</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">/// initialization)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The below is the pseudocode for what we have described</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">/// entry:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Initialize functionInvocationId</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">/// setjmp.dispatch:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">///    switch %label &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">///      label 1: goto post-setjmp BB 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">///      label 2: goto post-setjmp BB 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">///      ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">///      default: goto splitted next BB</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">///    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bb:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="comment">///   invoke void @foo() ;; foo is a longjmpable function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">///     to label %next unwind label %catch.dispatch.longjmp</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">/// catch.dispatch.longjmp:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %0 = catchswitch within none &#91;label %catch.longjmp&#93; unwind to caller</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="comment">/// catch.longjmp:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %longjmp.args = wasm.catch() ;; struct &#95;&#95;WasmLongjmpArgs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %env = load &#39;env&#39; field from &#95;&#95;WasmLongjmpArgs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %val = load &#39;val&#39; field from &#95;&#95;WasmLongjmpArgs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %label = &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;setjmp&#95;test(%env, functionInvocationId);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">///   if (%label == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">///     &#95;&#95;wasm&#95;longjmp(%env, %val)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">///   catchret to %setjmp.dispatch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="comment">///===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Exception-catching related functions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We intentionally treat &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;end&#95;catch longjmpable in Wasm SjLj even though</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it surely cannot longjmp, in order to maintain the unwind relationship from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// all existing catchpads (and calls within them) to catch.dispatch.longjmp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In Wasm EH + Wasm SjLj, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 Make all catchswitch and cleanuppad that unwind to caller unwind to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    catch.dispatch.longjmp instead</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 Convert all longjmpable calls to invokes that unwind to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    catch.dispatch.longjmp</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// But catchswitch BBs are removed in isel, so if an EH catchswitch (generated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from an exception)&#39;s catchpad does not contain any calls that are converted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into invokes unwinding to catch.dispatch.longjmp, this unwind relationship</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (EH catchswitch BB -&gt; catch.dispatch.longjmp BB) is lost and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// catch.dispatch.longjmp BB can be placed before the EH catchswitch BB in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CFGSort.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// int ret = setjmp(buf);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// try &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   foo(); // longjmps</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#125; catch (...) &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Then in this code, if &#39;foo&#39; longjmps, it first unwinds to &#39;catch (...)&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// catchswitch, and is not caught by that catchswitch because it is a longjmp,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="648"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then it should next unwind to catch.dispatch.longjmp BB. But if this &#39;catch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (...)&#39; catchswitch -&gt; catch.dispatch.longjmp unwind relationship is lost,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it will not unwind to catch.dispatch.longjmp, producing an incorrect</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// result.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="652"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="653"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Every catchpad generated by Wasm C++ contains &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;end&#95;catch, so we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="654"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intentionally treat it as longjmpable to work around this problem. This is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="655"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a hacky fix but an easy one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="656"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The comment block in findWasmUnwindDestinations() in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SelectionDAGBuilder.cpp is addressing a similar problem.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="659"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;cxa&#95;end&#95;catch&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly/#a877b8fcf196f226d4f2289ebdb1f276b">WebAssembly::WasmEnableSjLj</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;cxa&#95;begin&#95;catch&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><Highlight kind="normal">      CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;cxa&#95;allocate&#95;exception&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> || CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;cxa&#95;throw&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="normal">      CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;&#95;clang&#95;call&#95;terminate&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// std::terminate, which is generated when another exception occurs while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handling an exception, cannot longjmp.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CalleeName == </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&#95;ZSt9terminatev&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise we don&#39;t know</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#125; else &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %label = -1;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %longjmp&#95;result = getTempRet0();</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When a function contains a setjmp call but not other calls that can longjmp,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we don&#39;t do setjmp transformation for that setjmp. But we need to convert the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// returns 0 when called directly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If setjmp/longjmp handling is enabled, the thrown value can be not an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exception but a longjmp. If the current function contains calls to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// setjmp, it will be appropriately handled in runSjLjOnFunction. But even</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if the function does not contain setjmp calls, we shouldn&#39;t silently</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ignore longjmps; we should rethrow them so they can be correctly</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handled in somewhere up the call chain where setjmp is. &#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value is 0 when nothing happened, 1 when an exception is thrown, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// other values when longjmp is thrown.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if (%&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val == 0 || %&#95;&#95;THREW&#95;&#95;.val == 1)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   goto %tail</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   goto %longjmp.rethrow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rethrow.longjmp: ;; This is longjmp. Rethrow it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This tries to get debug info from the instruction before which a new</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction will be inserted, and if there&#39;s no debug info in that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, tries to get the info instead from the previous instruction (if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any). If none of these has debug info and a DISubprogram is provided, it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1244"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// creates a dummy debug info with the first line of the function, because IR</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// verifier requires all inlinable callsites should have debug info when both a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// caller and callee have DISubprogram. If none of these conditions are met,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// returns empty info.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1248" lineLink="#aaf95913e52851622a35765cc28adf643"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> <a href="#aaf95913e52851622a35765cc28adf643">getOrCreateDebugLoc</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;InsertBefore,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1343"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, our modifications to the cfg can break dominance of SSA variables.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, in this code,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if (x()) &#123; .. setjmp() .. &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1346"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if (y()) &#123; .. longjmp() .. &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1347"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We must split the longjmp block, and it can jump into the block splitted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1348"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from setjmp one. But that means that when we split the setjmp block, it&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1349"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first part no longer dominates its second part - there is a theoretically</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1350"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possible control flow path where x() is false, then y() is true and we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1351"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reach the second part of the setjmp block, without ever reaching the first</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1352"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// part. So, we rebuild SSA form here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1353"><Highlight kind="normal">  rebuildSSA(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1359"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// comments at top of the file for details.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WebAssemblyLowerEmscriptenEHSjLj::handleLongjmpableCallsForEmscriptenSjLj(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1589"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// entry.split: (OrigEntry)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
